annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the Department of Education Enabling Act ("Act").

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

para.text: "Agreement" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso governing Agreement.
"Council" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council.
"Governor" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Governor.
"Pueblo" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The Purpose of the Act is to establish the Department of Education.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: reorganizing the structure of governmental departments and programs will promote efficiency within the Tribe; and
establishing a Department of Education will assist the Tribe in achieving its educational endeavors.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: General Policy
section.text: Department of Education. This act shall establish the Department of Education to carry out the Pueblo's educational initiatives.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Organization of the Department of Education

para.text: There shall be a Director of the Department of Education who shall oversee the general supervision of the department.

In order to promote efficiency within the Department of Education, program offices will be established as necessary. A program director shall oversee the general supervision of the each program office and shall report to the Director of the Department of Education.
The Department of Education includes the following program offices:
Early Childhood
Farm
Scholarship
After School & Summer Program
Po-who-ge-oweenge (Tewa Language) Program

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Department of Education Goals and Objectives
section.text: The overall goals of the Department of Education ("Department") are to promote student achievement and educational excellence. The Department shall improve the quality and effectiveness of education andpromote interest in higher education.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Amendment
section.text: The Council may amend this enabling act or reorganize the Department of Education at any time upon majority vote of the Council.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Sovereign Immunity
section.text: Nothing in this Act waives the sovereign immunity of the Pueblo or any of its representatives, officers, or employees.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

section.heading: Severability
section.text: If a court of competent jurisdiction finds any provision of this Act to be invalid or illegal under applicable tribal and/or federal law, such provision shall be severed from this Act and the remainder of this Act shall remain in full force and effect.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-022

container.heading: San Ildefonso Pueblo Scholarship Endowment Fund

annotations.annotation: This law was originally enacted pursuant to Council Resolution No. SI-R12-001, dated January 3, 2012.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-001

para.text: The Pueblo recognizes that the Pueblo does have a Scholarship Endowment Fund for scholarships;

The Pueblo recognizes that the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Scholarship Endowment Fund must have an established principal amount; which cannot be used for scholarships, as only the interest earned on the principle amount can be used for scholarships.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-001

section.text: The total of $1,000,000.00 be recognized on the books of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso as the principal amount of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Scholarship Endowment Fund, and that any interest earned on the principal amount may be used exclusively for scholarships.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-001

section.text: The total of $1,025,000.00 be invested in United States Treasury Bill, with Los Alamos National Bank for a period of one (1) year. After one (1) years time an analysis will be done to determine what amount will be needed for scholarships for FY 2013. The Scholarship Endowment Fund amount will be established at that time.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-001

container.heading: Support Resolution For Pueblo de San Ildefonso Tewa Language Project

annotations.annotation: This law was originally enacted pursuant to Council Resolution No. SI-R12-010, dated January 26, 2012; (Note reference to 36-month project period).

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-010

para.text: Since time immemorial the Pueblo de San Ildefonso has spoken the Tewa language;

It is of grave concern to our People members that the Tewa language is not being reinforced as a primary language in our community; and it has always been the language through which the history, culture and governance have been passed on at the Pueblo de San Ildefonso;

In order for the Tewa language to survive as a primary language, Tewa language instruction must be implemented within all the learning environments of the Pueblo including the homes of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-010

section.text: Be it resolved that the Native Language Preservation and Maintenance application be submitted and if funding is awarded, project activities be implemented to accomplish the goals and objectives during the thirty-six month project period.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-010

section.text: Be it further resolved that the Tewa Language Committee be authorized, in conjunction with the Pueblo Department of Education, and community to develop a Tewa Language Revitalization Model, and develop and present draft Resolution on language issues to the Tribal Council for approval.

annotation.doc: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R12-010
